meanings.definition: To inflict a sudden, localized pain on (someone) by electric shock.
meanings.sent1: The police officer had to tase the criminal to stop him from running away.
meanings.sent2: The security guard may need to tase an intruder if they pose a threat.
meanings.sent3: I hope I never have to tase anyone, it sounds scary!
meanings.sent4: The shocking truth tased her like a bolt of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The electric fence will tase anyone who tries to climb over it.

meanings.definition: To stun or immobilize (someone) with a taser.
meanings.sent1: The officer had to tase the suspect to prevent any harm.
meanings.sent2: She was forced to tase the aggressive dog to protect herself.
meanings.sent3: It's not every day you have to tase someone, thankfully.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news tased her into silence.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's lightning powers could tase villains with a single touch.

meanings.definition: The act of using a taser to shock someone.
meanings.sent1: The tase of the criminal was necessary to ensure safety.
meanings.sent2: She received training on the proper tase technique for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: Witnessing the tase made me realize the seriousness of the situation.
meanings.sent4: The tase of the taser echoed through the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The loud tase of the taser made everyone jump in surprise.
